item.description:
RAIN PLAN - Look for us on the field (we're pretty open to playing in the rain), but if we're not there then we'll be at Ula's Cafe on Amory. From Stony Brook T follow the left path across the field and you'll reach Amory directly across from Ula's. It's very very close.

More likely we'll be on the field - it's a very slim chance at this point that it'll rain at all between 1 & 3pm. We're hoping it looks more like this:



Recess for Justice is going down at the Stonybrook court right off Lamartine Street in JP. (Exit Stonybrook T station on the Orange line, walk directly across the street to the park - we'll be on the field and in the courts right in front of you.)

Bring your favorite outdoor game or check out the assortment of fun we'll have on hand: frisbees, kickball & chalk (for 4-square!), nerf football, softball (bring a glove) and whatever other randomness we can think of.

If it's hot we can run through the fountain sprinkler to cool off.

Around 3pm we'll start to figure out what to do next. We might go to Ula Cafe or Java Jo's for coffee, smoothies, snacks and board games (bring 'em!).

Check out the photos from the last time we held Recess for Justice!



So look no further if you're seeking like-minded progressives to hang out with in Boston, want to cross-promote your events and campaigns while perfecting your frisbee forehand, or are new to the area and looking for groups to get involved in. If you're interested in building cross-issue coalitions courtside?even better!

At Socializing for Justice (SoJust) events you can hang out with friends, make new ones, find a date, get the scoop on a job, and find out what's going on this weekend - political or social. And the best part is that SoJust members share your vision of building a more just world.

Want to connect outside of SoJust events? Members can view and post events, job & volunteer announcements, roommate searches, etc. on the 'Message Board' and are encouraged to suggest and co-host events.

Wanna know more about SoJust? Check out our Frequently Asked Questions and Event Photos. Learn about our Suggested Annual Membership Fee.
item.name: Recess for Justice
